- Ozgur Karabult - Head of Sales/BD EMEA - 10 years at InventUK, Spain, Italy, DACHBackground industriral engineering Asked about Impact expanding into EU On assortment, it will be critical to ensure great flexibility of the tool and we need to determine how much analytics goes into the workflow. This could be more about automation Open to connecting again and help in any way possible
- Cagatay - Distinguished Engineer - Lives outside Boston - 5 months at InventEngineering lead to establish infrastructure and systems to scale - Platform side of E2ECurrently, focusing on mid market ($300-$400K) ARR - this is where sales is focusing (review this with Tav) Working to deliver faster implementation and tool setups - speed and scale are criticalProduct releases in 3 waves per year Shared two documents on design and engineering best practice (saved in Engineering bookmark)

er year Shared two documents on design and engineering best practice (saved in Engineering bookmark)

- no need to add to this if it doesn‚Äôt suit you, but I‚Äôm going to start noting down company and Assortment differentiators that we can build out for the sales team

Overall

- Delivery approach - Data and design is done concurrently - huge benefit
- Provable value - ROI is quantified to be the foundation for future work
- Time to market - 3 months from data receipt.

Assortment

fied to be the foundation for future work
- Time to market - 3 months from data receipt.

Assortment

- Visualization - allows the user to see both available products (carryover, best sellers) and new development. They can drive the art within the UI, keeping them here
- UI & Workflow - very logical and similar to how a Buyer works and thinks. First is visually understanding opportunity and selecting new styles, second comes the science and forecast to drive optimization
- Hind-sighting ‚ÄúHistory Hub‚Äù  - leverage tool for weekly sales analysis, this allows the user to interact with the tool more frequently than only at buy periods
- Base/Standard UI and rules flexibility- much quicker delivery and agility post go-live.

- Choice Count (CC) is defined as a style x color ( Ex 12345 - 001)
- SKU count is defined as style x color x size ( Ex 12345 - 001- XL)
- S/T (sell-thru) Defines rate of sale by calculating ---- sales units / (sales units +on-hand units) . For purpose of pre-season buying, season level targets will likely be set.
- Weeks at Reg : Identifies the number of weeks of selling for a style before a permanent markdown (actual inventory value is reduced)  is taken . At this time, goods move to a markdown fixture or section on the floor.
- Comp Style is referred to as a historical style with similar product details and attributes that is often used to build out placeholders.

High Level L1, L2 and L3L2 GoalsL3 - Assortment Administration - ExpandedL3 - Assortment Strategy - ExpandedL3 - Range Plan - ExpandedL3 - Range Plan by Cluster - ExpandedL3 - Buy Optimization - Expanded

# Phase-2 (SOW 3)

## System Definition

The System will be deployed with a single daily data integration for CLIENT ERP and operating systems.¬† The data integration covers all data files for all data exchange necessary for the solutions and services under the scope of this SOW3 for the current and future CLIENT brand(s) for retail and online business. In addition, a test environment that mirrors production for testing enhancements and upgrades shall be provided. As long as the data comes through the US database and is included in the same weekly meetings, it is included in this Scope.

Project Objectives

Assortment Planning will facilitate planning of product collections, sales forecasting, optimization of style and color assortments, streamlined inventory management, and the formulation of targeted marketing strategies.

Seamless Integration:

d inventory management, and the formulation of targeted marketing strategies.

Seamless Integration:

- Facilitate a streamlined workflow by ensuring AI-enhanced seamless integration with existing inventory systems, Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), e-commerce platforms, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, budgets, and store planning systems. This integration supports efficient and uninterrupted operations, enhancing productivity and reducing operational complexity with smart solutions.
- The end result will be seamless integration into a purchase order, reconciliation into financial planning and full integration into allocation and replenishment.

Data-Driven Decision Making:

ncial planning and full integration into allocation and replenishment.

Data-Driven Decision Making:

- Harness the power of AI to utilize a robust suite of data inputs including sales data, profit data, inventory data, store cluster data, assortment lists, SKU performance, and store capacities. This AI-driven approach is designed to meticulously tailor product assortments to accurately reflect market demands and maximize store capabilities, thereby optimizing resource allocation and enhancing market responsiveness.
- AI targets will be recommended at every step of the process and the user will be able to adjust as needed.

Global Usability with Local Customization:

- AI-powered platform with extensive customization options to meet diverse regional market conditions, compliance requirements, and specific customer behaviors. This ensures that our platform fits local market needs perfectly through next-gen solutions.
- Ability to view strategies across local markets and currency

perfectly through next-gen solutions.
- Ability to view strategies across local markets and currency

TheDeliverablesfor assortment planning will be:

Sales and Demand Forecasting:

- Equip the system with advanced forecasting platforms to predict future sales and product demand, allowing for better inventory management and marketing strategy formulation powered by AI.
- Capability to reconcile MFP / financial plans.
- Hindsighting to include potential lost sales quantification.
- Recommended AI generated store cluster targets, style color counts, and product attributes, buys.

Customizable Dashboards and Reports:

ter targets, style color counts, and product attributes, buys.

Customizable Dashboards and Reports:

- Provide dynamic reporting platforms that allow users to customize views to monitor various metrics and image views across different versions. These dashboards will facilitate real-time, data-driven decisions powered by AI and support hindsighting throughout the season. Ensure the system is equipped to run to speed adequately (i.e., withstand heavy requests with one-pagers, dashboards, etc.)
- Ability to see changes across the process (AI targets, different versions) or to export.
- Ability to see performance to date against the plan.
- Executive summary of buys and recommendations.

Style-Color Planning:

ce to date against the plan.
- Executive summary of buys and recommendations.

Style-Color Planning:

- Implement AI-based detailed interface to optimize the number and variety of style-color combinations based on historical sales data and emerging fashion trends across different store clusters and attributes. This will help align product offerings for core, trends and seasonal dynamics.

Range Planning:

- Implement AI-enhanced platforms for defining the assortment of products offered to customers over specific periods, focusing on the variety, quantity, and timing of products to maximize customer satisfaction and sales/margin.
- Ability to range plan season-over season and month-over-month.

Collection Planning:

- Provide a comprehensive overview interface for viewing and managing the entire product collection (images and data), enabling strategic adjustments and ensuring the collection aligns with brand identity and market trends.

Assortment Planning Outputs:

ensuring the collection aligns with brand identity and market trends.

Assortment Planning Outputs:

- Deliver detailed assortment plans that recommend optimal product mixes and initial inventory allocations tailored to specific store clusters, attributes or regions, based on comprehensive analytics and data integration, enhanced by AI.
